Policy.0: Estimate predicted demand for medical services based on projected rise in cases and proportion of severe illness (based on trends, variant data)
Policy.1: Ensure primary system in place to triage patients
Policy.2: Ramp up supply to meet peak projected demand
Policy.3: Train medical staff and medical students, interns, residents as back up
Policy.4: Prepare for oxygen generator plants on hospital premises with fire safety protocols in place
Policy.5: Suspend elective procedures and restrict OPDs for the duration of the surge
Policy.6: Unrestricted travel; international travellers from high burden countries undergo 7-day home quarantine (on submission of negative RT-PCR test on day 8)
Policy.7: Physical distancing enforced in long distance travel
Policy.8: Keep trains, buses, flights running with Rapid Antigen tests at bus and train stations and airports and physical distancing where possible
Policy.9: RT-PCR testing for all symptomatic patients and family contacts and other close contacts
Policy.10: Rapid antigen testing for confirming new clusters
Policy.13: Ramp up testing capacity to handle increased demand
Policy.14: Scale-up support to testing labs, including procurement of RT-PCR testing kits
Policy.16: Enable private sector to operate at different prices points for maximum coverage
Policy.19: Shops, restaurants, offices, places of worship, factories open with distancing and 50% occupancy
Policy.20: Essential services (food, medical sector, local transportation, public works, administrative services) open
Policy.23: Indoor confined spaces closed (specifics to be determined locally with consultations)
Policy.24: Social safety nets, food banks, other support for the poor in place
Policy.25: Restrictions on personal movement (with some exceptions)
Policy.26: Schools and colleges closed till numbers fall to medium risk category
Policy.27: Shops, restaurants, offices, places of worship, factories closed for a minimum of 6-10 weeks
Policy.28: Coordinate localized locked downs in a synchronous manner
Policy.29: Community level contact tracing teams set up and trained
Policy.30: Retrospective and forward contact tracing for all confirmed cases
Policy.31: Home or community quarantining/isolation facilities in place
Policy.32: Immediate family and broader set of contacts traced, tested and isolated
Policy.33: Community level contact tracing teams focus on forward contact tracing for confirmed cases
Policy.35: Create, update, disseminate training materials for decentralized contact tracing teams
Policy.36: Create/manage centralized database to support and sync information from decentralized contact tracing
Policy.37: Coordinate community contact tracing with district administration
Policy.38: Transparent reporting of cases, hospitalizations, deaths (age, sex disaggregated)
Policy.39: Daily official briefings from credible, non partisan, centralized source within government
Policy.40: High-profile campaign with clear messaging on mask wearing, ventilation, distancing, vaccinations
Policy.41: Recognition of diversity of circumstances/population groups
Policy.42: Coordinated messages between Center and States
Policy.44: Credible projections of trajectory of the pandemic done regularly
Policy.45: System of sharing anonymized, microdata for understanding the pandemic
Policy.46: 5% tests to undergo genome sequencing, with VoC data shared with districts
Policy.47: Open datasets for real time research
Policy.48: Use data for evidence based decision making
Policy.49: Central War Room with Chief Ministers, leaders of all political parties
Policy.50: State and district level war rooms
Policy.51: Independent technical team comprising national experts to analyze and present data and solutions
Policy.53: Clear accountability and responsibility at central, state, and district level
Policy.54: Prioritize vulnerable segments of the population, including teachers and school staff
Policy.55: Plan for expansion of vaccinations based on supply projections
Policy.56: Ramp up supply on an expedited basis
Policy.58: Gatherings of up to 50 allowed in open air settings
Policy.59: Venues that accommodate more than 50 closed
Policy.60: Gatherings of up to 10 allowed in open air settings
Policy.61: Venues that accommodate more than 10 closed
Policy.64: Double masking encouraged in high risk settings
Policy.65: Focus on good ventilation in all indoor spaces
